column1: Nearly all immunizations (also called vaccinations) need to be given into the muscle or under the skin using a needle and syringe.
WHAT TO EXPECT AT HOME After the shot is given, a cool, damp cloth may be placed on the vaccination site to help reduce soreness.
Frequently moving or using the arm or leg that received the shot may also help reduce the soreness.
Giving your child acetaminophen or ibuprofen may help relieve common, minor symptoms after immunizations.
